cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 140 miles NW of San Juan, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest, passing north of Hispaniola and moving toward the Turks & Caicos, southeastern/central Bahamas, and eventually Florida

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watches are in effect only for Cuba (Matanzas eastward) and the north-western Bahamas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warnings cover Puerto Rico, northern Hispaniola and the Turks & Caicos / southeastern & central Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, northern Hispaniola, Turks & Caicos, Bahamas, and eventually the Florida peninsula
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm to hurricane-force gusts have already occurred; winds are now steadily decreasing as Irma moves away
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation of 1–3 ft that is now subsiding
weather_observation.rainfall: Additional 2–4 inches possible; locally higher amounts unlikely
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents will persist for another 24 h
